ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: About basic quantum many body theory
I learned many useful topics relevant to my research and gained more mathematic skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is well organized. But it's kind of repetitive for the beginning of the class.

The course covers many good topics and professor Alhassid's derivations in class are very helpful. The notes sometimes are too concise so I think it would be helpful if we know more clearly where to read for each chapter.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Detailed explain basic theories about manybody system.

Yoram taught a decent basic course in quantum many-body theory, but we didn't get to as many applications as I would have liked. His treatment of second quantization was excellent, but for the rest of the course I struggled to gain intuition from his lectures.
Yes it covers many important topics for those who do theoretical work
